Class Processor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Processor

  • public class Processor
extends java.lang.Object
    Processor is a class where it manipulates a bufferedImage, causing transformations, color changes, changing specific rgb values to create effects. It also contains an undo and redo feature and processes the image. It demonstrates the use of unpacking a pixel and repacking a pixel to change the rgb values of the desired picture
    Version:
    2018-11-20
    Author:
    Jonathan Wong

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void greyScale(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi)
      This method will find average of the red, green, blue values and set all of them to be that value to turn the picture gray.
      static int packagePixel(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      Takes in a red, green, blue and alpha integer and uses bit-shifting to package all of the data into a single integer.
      static int[] unpackPixel(int rgbaValue)
      Takes in an rgb value - the kind that is returned from BufferedImage's getRGB() method - and returns 4 integers for easy manipulation.

    • Method Detail

      • greyScale

        public static void greyScale(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi)
        This method will find average of the red, green, blue values and set all of them to be that value to turn the picture gray. Demonstrates use of packagePixel() and unpackPixel() methods.
        Parameters:
        bi - The BufferedImage (passed by reference) to change.

      • packagePixel

        public static int packagePixel(int r,
                               int g,
                               int b,
                               int a)
        Takes in a red, green, blue and alpha integer and uses bit-shifting to package all of the data into a single integer.
        Parameters:
        int - red value (0-255)
        int - green value (0-255)
        int - blue value (0-255)
        int - alpha value (0-255)
        Returns:
        int Integer representing 32 bit integer pixel ready for BufferedImage

      • unpackPixel

        public static int[] unpackPixel(int rgbaValue)
        Takes in an rgb value - the kind that is returned from BufferedImage's getRGB() method - and returns 4 integers for easy manipulation. By Jordan Cohen Version 0.2
        Parameters:
        rgbaValue - The value of a single pixel as an integer, representing
        8 bits for red, green and blue and 8 bits for alpha:
        alpha   red     green   blue
        00000000000000000000000000000000
        Returns:
        int[4] Array containing 4 shorter ints
        0       1       2       3
        alpha   red     green   blue
